title: Brian Eno & John Cale - Wrong Way Up
description:
Wrong Way Up - Brian Eno & John Cale - 1990

Track listing
01 - "Lay My Love" (4:44) 
02 - "One Word" (4:34) 
03 - "In the Backroom" (4:02) 
04 - "Empty Frame" (4:26) 
05 - "Cordoba" (4:22) 
06 - "Spinning Away" (5:27) 
07 - "Footsteps" (3:13) 
08 - "Been There, Done That" (2:52) 
09 - "Crime in the Desert" (3:42) 
10 - "The River" (4:23) 

Personnel
John Cale: vocals, pianos, keyboards, bass, harp, horn, dumbek, viola, strings, omnichord 
Brian Eno: vocals, keyboards, rhythm bed, Indian drum, guitars, Shinto bell, bass, little Nigerian organ 
Robert Ahwai: rhythm guitar 
Nell Catchpole: violins 
Rhett Davies: backing vocals 
Daryl Johnson: bass 
Ronald Jones: tabla, drums 
Bruce Lampcov: backing vocals 
Dave Young: guitars, bass
 
MP3 - VBR (235av) - 74.6MB

Both Brian Eno and John Cale have always flirted with conventional pop music throughout their careers, while reserving the right to go off on less accessible experiments, which means they&#039;ve always held out the promise that they would make something as attractive as this synthesizer-dominated collection, on which Eno comes as close to the mainstream as he has since Another Green World and Cale is as catchy as he&#039;s been since Honi Soit. The result is one of the best albums either one has ever made. 

Enjoy!
